title: Ticket #5942: Refresh classad usermaps by timer, without a full reconfig
description:
Both CERN and CMS would like some enhancement in how the new classad usermaps are refreshed. (Usermaps implemented in #5751)

Currently the usermaps are only called within DC::Reconfig by their nature of being inside the classads lib.

Currently CERN is generating the mapfiles atomically and calling condor_reconfig.

We'd like to keep the mapfiles on disk but allow DaemonCore to refresh the maps on a timer.

For CMS their use-case is slightly different in that they'd like to base their config on the MAPDATA variant and have the daemon-core timer ensure a call-out is run which refreshes the mapdata.

Talking with BrianB the suggestion is as far as the timer goes, we base it off the DNS Cache example, already in DaemonCore. (See: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/blob/master/src/condor_daemon_core.V6/daemon_core.cpp#L2959)

This would require exposing the reconfig_user_maps function from classad_usermaps.h to daemonCore.

A new config knob for specifying the timer, which defaults to 15 minutes(?)

CLASSAD_USER_MAP_REFRESH_INTERVAL
remarks:
2016-Oct-03 13:37:56 by iain.steers:
I'm happy to submit a patch for the CERN case.

The CMS looks more complicated and may require Brian or TJ to review.
